data.title: 1641 Depositions
data.description: A database where sources regarding the rebellion of 1641 in Ireland can be found. The database consists of sources provided by the Trinity College Dublin and may interest researchers of religions, Catholicism and Protestantism, as well as Irish, Scottish and English early modern history.

data.title: Abbildungsverzeichnis der europäischen Kaiser- und Königsurkunden

data.title: Abbreviationes Online - Medieval Abbreviations on the Web
data.description: A website for learning, teaching and researching medieval Latin texts and decrypting abbreviations.

data.title: academia.edu
data.description: A database for research articles.

data.title: Acta Pacis Westphalicae (apw)
data.description: A publication series regarding the Peace of Westphalia 1648, including document editions, research literature and reviews by the University of Bonn, Germany.

data.title: Advaita Vedanta
data.description: An introductional site of Indian philosophy and history of Advaita Vedanta.

data.title: Aegyptiaca - Ägyptologische Literaturdatenbank
data.description: A database collecting information about egyptological literature. It seems that the database itself does not host any of those publications itself.

data.title: AfricaMap
data.description: An interactive map of Africa with data of various research genres such as structural changes, political shifts, (slave) trade and ports, religion and ethnicity etc.

data.title: Agade Archive - Agade Mailing List (AWOL)

data.title: Aktenkunde Hypotheses - Aktenlesen als Historische Hilfswissenschaft

data.title: Alberti Magni e-corpus

data.title: Alexandrian Documents from the Reign of Augustus

data.title: Alpage - Analyse diachronique de l'espace urbain parisien : approche geomatique

data.title: Das altägyptische Totenbuch - ein digitales Textzeugenarchiv
data.description: A database for information concerning the Book of the Dead for egyptologists.

data.title: The American Presidency Project (APP)

data.title: The American Association of Papyrologists (ASP)
data.description: The webpage of the ASP, which is also the publisher of the journal The Bulletin of the American Society of Papyrologists.

data.title: American Journal of Archaeology (AJA)
data.description: The website of a quarterly publishing peer-reviewed journal for archeologists.

data.title: The American Research Center in Egypt (ARCE)
data.description: An organization supporting many aspects of egyptology.

data.title: The American Society of Greek and Latin Epigraphy (ASGLE)

data.title: Ancient Egyptian Architecture Online (AEGARON)

data.title: Ancient World Online (AWOL)
data.description: A blog for resources of Ancient Studies.

Anemi Digital Library - The Digital Library of Modern Greek Studies
Anglo American Legal Tradtion (AALT) - Documents from Medieval and Early Modern England from the National Archives in London
ANNO Historische Zeitungen und Zeitschriften

data.title: Library of Iberian Resources Online (LIBRO)
data.description: Bibliographical lists of research concerning the history of Iberian peninsula, partially available with a digital version of the resource.

data.title: Librivox
data.description: A collection of free audiobooks from copyright free books with literature of the 19th and 20th century.

data.title: Lichtbildarchiv älterer Originalurkunden (LBA)

data.title: Ligages et filiations généalogiques de la France
data.description: A website dedicated to genealogy, especially to the noble lineage of Montfort and the region of Yvelines (France).

data.title: Literaturkritik
data.description: A website dedicated to literature reviews.

data.title: Liverpool Classicist Mailing List
data.description: A platform for classicists regarding information about news, conferences, summer schools and other research and educational opportunities.

data.title: The Living Room Candidate, Museum of the Moving Image - Presidential Campaign Commercials 1952-2020
data.description: A collection of US presidential campaign commercials based on video material.

data.title: Livius.org - Articles on ancient history
data.description: A collection of articles regarding Antiquity organized by geographical region.

data.title: Logeion ΛΟΓΕΙΟΝ
data.description: A dictionary of classical Greek and Latin.

data.title: Louvre Collections
data.description: Online digital collections of sources provided by Musée du Louvre and Musée National Eugène-Delacroix, Paris, France.

data.title: Low Countries Data Collection (Dataverse, IISH Data Collection)
data.description: A collection of data sets of the history of the Low Countries, especially cartographic and numismatic data.

data.title: Lüdicke, K.: Kanonistenlateinisch-deutsches Lexikon
data.description: A glossary of canonical Latin.

data.title: Magdeburger Spuren
data.description: A project dedicated to European archival sources referencing Magdeburg, Germany, for historical reconstruction purposes as well as for compensating the loss of the sources in the 17th century.

data.title: The Maine Memory Network
data.description: A website dedicated to sources of Maine, US.

data.title: The Making of Charlemagne's Europe
data.description: A database of legal documents from the 8th / 9th century from the era of Charlemagne focusing on personal interrelationships.

data.title: Manar al-Athar digital archive
data.description: A digital collection of images concerning archaeology, architecture and art from Antiquity.

data.title: Manchester Digital Collections (MDC)
data.description: The digital Collection section of Manchester University, England.

data.title: Mandragore - base des manuscrits enluminés de la BnF
data.description: A database of illuminated manuscripts of the Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France, BnF).

data.title: Maniculae - Beiträge zur Überlieferung mittelalterlicher Texte
data.description: The webpage of the open access journal Maniculae that focuses on manuscripts of the Middle Ages. The project's origin can be seen in the project of Handschriftencensus, that is also dedicated to medieval manuscripts.

data.title: Manitius, M.: Geschichte der lateinischen Literatur des Mittelalters, Teil 1, 5. Jh - 10. Jh.
data.description: A collection of Latin works and authors from the Middle Ages. This is volume 1. It broadly covers the timespan between the 5th and the 10th century.

data.title: Manitius, M.: Geschichte der lateinischen Literatur des Mittelalters, Teil 2, 10. Jh. - 12. Jh.
data.description: A collection of Latin works and authors from the Middle Ages. This is volume 2. It broadly covers the timespan between the 10th and the 12th century.

data.title: Manitius, M.: Geschichte der lateinischen Literatur des Mittelalters, Teil 3, 12. Jh. - 13. Jh.
data.description: A collection of Latin works and authors from the Middle Ages. This is volume 3. It broadly covers the timespan between the 12th and the 13th century.

data.title: Manus Online (MOL)
data.description: A collection of manuscripts from Italian libraries. Every entry is generally provided with an extensive metadata description as well as a digitization of the manuscript.

data.title: Le manuscrit médiéval - The Medieval Manuscript
data.description: A blog dedicated to the history of Brittany (Bretagne), France, and its sources, especially with a focus on the Middle Ages.

data.title: Manuscripta Mediaevalia
data.description: A collection of manuscripts, generally from German libraries. The site provides metadata description as well as further codicological / paleographical information.

data.title: manuscripta.at - Mittelalterliche Handschriften in Österreich
data.description: A database for manuscripts of the Middle Ages, similar to Manuscripta Mediaevalia, but from Austrian libraries.

data.title: Manuscripts of Lichfield Cathedral
data.description: A project dedicated to the digitization of the two sources St Chad Gospels and the Wycliffe New Testament of the 8th / 15th centuries from the Lichfield Cathedral in England.

data.title: Manuscripts of the West Midlands (MWM)
data.description: An alphabetical list of manuscripts of the 14th and 15th centuries of the English West Midlands including their physical descriptions, interesting for paleographical and codicological research.

data.title: Manuscripts Online - Written Culture 1000 to 1500
data.description: A database of manuscripts of Britain from the Middle Ages. It also provides early printed books.

data.title: Map History / History of Cartography
data.description: A collection of maps and cartography related information with many external links.

data.title: Mapping Gothic France
data.description: A database dedicated to Gothic architecture in the 12th and 13th century, mostly in today's France and England.

data.title: Mapping Medieval Chester - Place and identity in an English borderland city c.1200-1500
data.description: A project dedicated to Chester, England, in the Middle Ages.

data.title: Mapping Metaphor with the Historical Thesaurus
data.description: A database of English metaphorical language, devided into Old English and English.

data.title: Mapping Past Societies (Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations, DARMC)
data.description: A cartographic project dedicated to different epochs and topics.

data.title: Mapping Past Societies - DARMC Archeological Studies
data.description: A cartographical project with a map of archeological surveys.

data.title: Mapping Past Societies - DARMC Environmental Studies
data.description: A cartographical project with a map of sources related to environmental history or history catastrophies and natural disasters.

data.title: Mapping Past Societies - DARMC Medieval World
data.description: A cartographical project with a map of major towns mostly in the Europe of the Middle Ages.

data.title: Mapping Past Societies - DARMC Roman World
data.description: A cartographical project with a map of Roman forts, towers and roads.

data.title: Marcos, J.-J.: Fonts for Latin Paleography
data.description: An introduction to paleography, focusing on the different fonts and letters roughly from Antiquity to the Early Modern Period.

data.title: MARGOT
data.description: A meta project site for projects concerning the French Middle Ages and Early Modern Period. Its sub-projects are Cantus, French women writers from the ancien régime, German adaptations of French Chansons de Geste, Reading the Roman de la rose in text and image, Christine de Pizan Digital Scriptorium and The Campsey project.

data.title: Marteau Early 18th-Century Currency Converter
data.description: An economic history oriented database for 18th century currency, not only limited to Europe but it also includes Asia and Africa.

data.title: Mathieu, B.: Abréviations des périodiques et collections (IFAO)
data.description: A list of abbreviations of journals in the field of oriental archaeology.

data.title: Media Center for Art History
data.description: A picture collection of art, object and architecture.

data.title: Mediävistenverband
data.description: An association of German speaking researchers of the Middle Ages.

data.title: Mediaevum
data.description: An information website for researchers of the old German language studies.

data.title: The Medieval Academy Blog
data.description: An association of North-American researchers of the Middle Ages.

data.title: Medieval and Early Modern Russia and Ukraine
data.description: A list of online resources of history ranging from today's non Russian parts of Eastern Europe to the European side of Russia. The list not only covers primary sources in general, but also aspects of cartography, numismatics, architecture and more. Many links are already dead. However, one can still use the list as research inspiration.

data.title: The Medieval Bestiary - Animals in the Middle Ages

data.title: Medieval Canon Law Virtual Library
data.description: A collection of digitized Medieval Canon Law related sources.

data.title: Medieval Digital Resources (MDR)
data.description: A project to collect relevant digital resources and websites alphabetically. Although it is similar to Historia Quick Launcher, each website entry comes with an extensive description.

data.title: Medieval Electronic Scholarly Alliance (MESA)
data.description: A collaborative platform for medievalists and their projects, including forum and classroom environments.

data.title: Medieval England Maritime Project (MEMP, Fordham)

data.title: Medieval English Towns

data.title: Medieval Histories - Nature History Heritage

data.title: Medieval History Database (MHDB)
data.description: A database of sources of the Middle Ages.

data.title: Medieval Kingdom of Sicily Image Database - A Visual Resource of Historical Sites c. 1100 - c. 1450

data.title: Medieval Latin in Poland

data.title: Medieval Libraries of Great Britain (MLGB3)

data.title: Medieval London (Fordham)

data.title: Medieval Londoners (Fordham)

data.title: Medieval Manuscripts in Oxford Libraries
data.description: A collection of manuscripts of the Middle Ages that can be found in Libraries of Oxford, England.

data.title: Medieval Manuscripts in Dutch Collections (MMDC)

data.title: Medieval New York (Fordham)

data.title: Medieval Nordic Literature in Latin

data.title: Medieval plants Blog (MPS)

data.title: The Medieval Review
data.description: A journal for reviews of research articles concerning the Middle Ages.

data.title: Medieval Soldier - The Soldier in Later Medieval England

data.title: medieval worlds
data.description: An open access journal for research regarding the Middle Ages.

data.title: Medievalists.net
data.description: An information site for various topics concerning the Middle Ages.

data.title: Medium
data.description: A database of manuscripts from France and other countries.

data.title: The Mediterranean Seminar
data.description: A website for researchers of the history of the Mediterranean area.

data.title: Mémonum - Bibliothèque numérique patrimoniale - Montpellier 3M

data.title: Ménestrel - Médiévistes sur le net : sources, travaux et références en ligne

It also includes websites of major libraries. The descriptions of the websites are rather extensive.

data.title: Ménestrel - Médiévistes sur le net : sources, travaux et références en ligne (Sources et ressources)
data.description: A website, similar to the core idea of the Historia Quick Launcher plugin, dedicated to digital resources for medieval studies as well as researchers and students interested in the Middle Ages in general. This link directly leads to the catalog of manuscripts.

data.title: Menota - Arkiv for nordiske middelaldertekster - Medieval Nordic Text Archive

data.title: The Ming History English Translation Project

data.title: Naval Marine Archive - The Canadian Collection - Ships database

data.title: Online Archive for California (OAC)

data.title: Online Coins of the Roman Empire (OCRE)

data.title: Online Egyptological Bibliography (OEB)

data.title: The Open Access Companion to the Canterbury Tales - a new way to learn about old books
openArtBrowser

data.title: Opera Camerarii
data.description: A data collection of Joachim Camerarius' works.
